page.title: 01ETHNIC CONSIDERATIONS
page.content: THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE OF {AFRO-CARRIBBEAN}BACKGROUND IS QUITE HIGH BUT NOT AS HIGH AS THE{ASIAN COMMUNITY.THE PATTERN OF SETTLEMENT HERE,AS A WHOLE,TENDS TO BE MIXED IN TERMS OF WHICH ISLAND THEY CAME FROM( FOR{WEST INDIANS}).MOST PEOPLE SEEM TO HAVE COME FROM{JAMAICA}AND TO A LESSER EXTENT{BARBADOS}THEIR{RELIGION}REMAINS ISLAND BOUND E.G{JAMAICANS}ARE LARGELY {PENTECOSTAL;BARBADIANS,ANGLICANS.RASTI {FARIANS}WHO STARTED OFF LARGELY FROM JAMAICA TEND NOW TO BE FAIRLY SPREAD ACROSS THE ISLANDS. {AFRICANS}ARE LESS IN EVIDENCE,MOST ARE FROM{WEST AFRICA}(MAINLY{NIGERIA}AND {GHANA})WITH A FEW FROM{ZIMBABWE}.THE NEEDS OF THE AFRO-CARRIBEAN COMMUNITY SEEM LIMITED TO THE VERY YOUNG AND THE VERY OLD.IN PARTICULAR THERE IS AN AWARENESS OF{INTIMIDATION}EXPERIENCED BY YOUNG MOTHERS AND THE ABSENCE OF
